title: Atom structure - get Z from force-distance graph

content.question: The graph shows how the attractive force between an electron and a bare nucleus varies with the distance between the electron and the nucleus. Which of the following could represent the nucleus?

choices.label: <math alttext="H with mass number 1 and atomic number 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>H</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>1</mn><mn>1</mn></mmultiscripts></math>
<math alttext="H e with mass number 4 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>He</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mmultiscripts></math>
<math alttext="B e with mass number 9 and atomic number 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Be</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>4</mn><mn>9</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

<math alttext="A l with mass number 27 and atomic number 13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Al</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>13</mn><mn>27</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="B e with mass number 9 and atomic number 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Be</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>4</mn><mn>9</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

topic.text: 15.2: The Bohr Model of Atomic Structure

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
